result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine W Renix Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan in court for Jermaine W Renix Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jermaine W Renix Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan appeared by video for Jermaine W Renix Jr.  Attorney John J Rejowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. Mr Renix is in quarantine at HOC, unable to appear for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE HANRAHAN, BRANCH 4.

HELD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Jermaine W Renix Jr not in Court, in custody. Attorney John J Rejowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Public Defender's Office has NOT appointed counsel for Defendant. Due to COVID-19 protocol, Defendant was NOT produced for today's hearing. Court took no action regarding bail. Court cancelled Bail/Bond hearing.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jermaine W Renix Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan appeared by video for Jermaine W Renix Jr.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin .Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. State request to be heard on bail before the trial court. Case is adjourned to Br. 46 for branch 4 for bail hearing. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
